column1: It was asserted that these escapes were organised by a band of Englishmen
column2: whose daring seemed to be unparalleled
column4: from sheer desire to meddle in what did not concern them
column5: spent their spare time in snatching away lawful victims destined for Madame la Guillotine. These rumours soon grew in extravagance; there was no doubt that this band of meddlesome Englishmen did exist; moreover
column6: they seemed to be under the leadership of a man whose pluck and audacity were almost fabulous. Strange stories were afloat of how he and those aristos whom he rescued became suddenly invisible as they reached the barricades and escaped out of the gates by sheer supernatural agency.No one had seen these mysterious Englishmen; as for their leader
column8: save with a superstitious shudder. Citoyen Foucquier-Tinville would in the course of the day receive a scrap of paper from some mysterious source; sometimes he would find it in the pocket of his coat
column9: at others it would be handed to him by someone in the crowd
column10: whilst he was on his way to the sitting of the Committee of Public Safety.
